relation: Great for these types of students
Intramurals: broomball, basketball, soccer, frisbee, volleyball ect. Go to the nasty bars.
The freshmen dorms are ridiculously small and crappy. Internet connection isn't promising. The sophomore towers are also junk.
The fisheries and wildlife department is an excellent education opportunity.
Suck up to your professors, it will make a difference in your grade. Play intramural sports. There isn't many places to work off campus.
The professors are very helpful and personable. The dorm life sucks, and there isn't much to do in the town. Not the greatest college choice.
pageTitle: Lake Superior State University (LSSU) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {15260=sault ste. marie michigan hosts the i500 (large snowmobile race) every february and it brings the whole town together as well as many students from campus. the i500 has become a town tradition. the d1 hockey team also brings the whole town together on game nights to support them. it's a great family atmosphere when the town comes together., 4627=Try and spread out your Gen Ed's for the summer if you're planning on leasing off campus, that way you can take time on your major classes without feeling overwhemled with needed extras. Also, as of right now (2009 - 2010 school year), you'll pay a flat rate for credits. So whether you take 12 or 17 credits, you're paying the same amount. This would be the college to take that yoga class, or to learn to scuba dive. You'll enjoy it, and it'll be a stress reliever. Plus, you're already paying for it., 118653=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Great for these types of students Nursing students, Fire Science students, CJ students, Fishers students, and some select others. Tips for prospective students Try and spread out your Gen Ed's for the summer if you're planning on leasing off campus, that way you can take time on your major classes without feeling overwhemled with needed extras. Also, as of right now (2009 - 2010 school year), you'll pay a flat rate for credits. So whether you take 12 or 17 credits, you're paying the same amount. This would be the college to take that yoga class, or to learn to scuba dive. You'll enjoy it, and it'll be a stress reliever. Plus, you're already paying for it.
